Segment.name: BAX
Segment.comment: To transmit identifying numbers, dates, and other basic data relating to the transaction set

Field.name: StandardPointLocationCode1
Field.comment: Code (Standard Point Location) defined by National Motor Freight Tariff Association (NMFTA) or the Canadian Transportation Agency (CTA) point development group as the official code assigned to a city or point (for ratemaking purposes) within a city

Field.name: TypeOfConsistCode
Field.comment: Code indicating the type of consist

Field.name: DateTimeQualifier
Field.comment: Code specifying type of date or time, or both date and time

Field.name: Date1
Field.comment: Date expressed as CCYYMMDD where CC represents the first two digits of the calendar year

Field.name: Time1
Field.comment: Time expressed in 24-hour clock time as follows: HHMM, or HHMMSS, or HHMMSSD, or HHMMSSDD, where H = hours (00-23), M = minutes (00-59), S = integer seconds (00-59) and DD = decimal seconds; decimal seconds are expressed as follows: D = tenths (0-9) and DD = hundredths (00-99)

Field.name: StandardPointLocationCode2
Field.comment: Code (Standard Point Location) defined by National Motor Freight Tariff Association (NMFTA) or the Canadian Transportation Agency (CTA) point development group as the official code assigned to a city or point (for ratemaking purposes) within a city

Field.name: ReferenceIdentification
Field.comment: Reference information as defined for a particular Transaction Set or as specified by the Reference Identification Qualifier

Field.name: Date2
Field.comment: Date expressed as CCYYMMDD where CC represents the first two digits of the calendar year

Field.name: Time2
Field.comment: Time expressed in 24-hour clock time as follows: HHMM, or HHMMSS, or HHMMSSD, or HHMMSSDD, where H = hours (00-23), M = minutes (00-59), S = integer seconds (00-59) and DD = decimal seconds; decimal seconds are expressed as follows: D = tenths (0-9) and DD = hundredths (00-99)

Field.name: TimeCode
Field.comment: Code identifying the time. In accordance with International Standards Organization standard 8601, time can be specified by a + or - and an indication in hours in relation to Universal Time Coordinate (UTC) time; since + is a restricted character, + and - are substituted by P and M in the codes that follow

Field.name: TransactionSetPurposeCode
Field.comment: Code identifying purpose of transaction set

Field.name: ServiceLevelCode
Field.comment: Code indicating the level of transportation service or the billing service offered by the transportation carrier

SyntaxNote.name: C1110
SyntaxNote.comment: If BAX11 is present, then BAX10 is required.

SyntaxNote.name: C1211
SyntaxNote.comment: If BAX12 is present, then BAX11 is required.
